definitions.definition: To pull or gather up (an item of fabric ).
To push into a snug position; to place somewhere safe , or handy , or somewhat hidden .
examples: Tuck in your shirt.  I tucked in the sheet.  He tucked the $10 bill into his shirt pocket.
The sofa tucks nicely into that corner.  Kenwood House is tucked into a corner of Hampstead Heath.

definitions.definition: To curl into a ball; to fold up and hold one's legs .
examples: The diver tucked , flipped, and opened up at the last moment.

definitions.definition: To sew folds; to make a tuck or tucks in.
To conceal one’s penis and testicles , as with a gaff or by fastening them down with adhesive tape .
examples: Honey, have you tucked today? We don’t wanna see anything nasty down there.
definitions.label_groups: LGBTQ , of a drag queen , trans woman , etc.

definitions.definition: To keep the thumb in position while moving the rest of the hand over it to continue playing keys that are outside the thumb.
labels: when playing scales on piano keys
definitions.label_groups: when playing scales on piano keys

examples: Never take a first-generation Learjet past Mach 0.82; it'll tuck hard nose-down and you won't be able to pull out from the dive.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To pull or gather up (an item of fabric ). [From 14 c.]
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To push into a snug position; to place somewhere safe , or handy , or somewhat hidden . [From 1580s.]
( intransitive , often with "in" or "into" ) To eat ; to consume. [From 1780s.]
To curl into a ball; to fold up and hold one's legs .
To sew folds; to make a tuck or tucks in.
( LGBTQ , of a drag queen , trans woman , etc. ) To conceal one’s penis and testicles , as with a gaff or by fastening them down with adhesive tape .
( when playing scales on piano keys ) To keep the thumb in position while moving the rest of the hand over it to continue playing keys that are outside the thumb.
